API Reference¶

The frewpy library is made up of 5 core modules. These core modules are brought together in the FrewModel object from the frew_model module . If users wish to extend the functionality of frewpy, they can import the utils module and write their own functions or write into the source code of one of the core models which will automatically get pulled into the ‘FrewModel’ object. If the extended functionality is useful, it would be good to contribute towards the library so the others can benefit om the work as well. Remember, the functionality you’re using may have been added to the library in the same scenario.

Frew Model¶

This module holds the main class of FrewModel which is used to instantiate a single Frew model. The class incorporates all other child classes to make it easier for the user to interact with the frewpy library.

class frewpy.frew_model.FrewModel(file_path: str)¶

A class used to establish a connection to any Frew model and to manipulate it using the core methods or a child class’s methods.

…

file_path¶

The absolute file path to the Frew model.

Type

str

folder_path¶

The absolute folder path to the Frew model, not including the file name.

Type

str

wall¶

All wall related methods associated with a Frew model.

Type

class

soil¶

All soil related methods associated with a Frew model.

Type

class

water¶

All water related methods associated with a Frew model.

Type

class

calculation¶

All calculation methods based on Frew results.

Type

class

strut¶

All strut related methods associated with a Frew model.

Type

class

analyse() → None¶

Analyse the model using the COM interface to open Frew. This method requires greater than Frew 19.4 Build 24.

get(request: str) → Union[dict, str, int, list]¶

Method to get information about the model.

Parameters

request (str) – Options for request are: ‘titles’, ‘file history’, ‘file version’, ‘frew version’, ‘num stages’, ‘stage names’, ‘num nodes’.

Returns

return_value – The information requested about the model.

Return type

Union[dict, str, int, list]

Raises

FrewError – If request input is not a string or is not one of the options.

save(save_path: str = None) → None¶

Saves the current json Frew model to the original file or to a new path if provided to the method.

Parameters

save_path (str, optional) – The path including file name (.json) for the data to be saved to. If this is not provided, the model at the original file path will be overwritten.

Soil¶

This module holds the class Soil which aims to group all the soil related functionality of frewpy.

class frewpy.models.soil.Soil(json_data: Dict[str, list])¶

A class used to contain any soil related functionality of frewpy. Methods of this class will directly interact with the model data.

get_material_properties(material: str) → Dict[str, Union[float, int, dict]]¶

Method to get all the properties of a specific material.

Parameters

material (str) – The name of the material to return the properties for.

Returns

material_properties – The properties of the input material.

Return type

Dict[str, Union[float, int, dict, bool]]

get_materials() → List[str]¶

Method to get names of all the materials used within the Frew model.

Returns

materials – A list of the materials in the Frew model.

Return type

List[str]

Raises

FrewError – If there are no materials in the model.

Wall¶

This module holds the class for the Wall object.

class frewpy.models.wall.Wall(json_data)¶

A class used to contain any wall related functionality of frewpy.

get_envelopes() → Dict[str, dict]¶

Method to return the envelopes of max and min shear, bending and displacements for each design case.

Returns

envelopes – The maximum and minimum shear, bending and displacement for each design case for all stages.

Return type

Dict[str, dict]

get_node_levels() → List[float]¶

Method to get the levels of the nodes in a Frew model.

Returns

node_levels – The levels of each node in a Frew model.

Return type

List[float]

get_results() → Dict[int, dict]¶

Method to get the shear, bending moment and displacement of the wall for each stage, node, and design case.

Returns

wall_results – The shear, bending and displacement of the wall.

Return type

Dict[int, dict]

get_wall_stiffness() → Dict[int, List[float]]¶

Function to get the stiffness of the wall for each stage and node.

Returns

wall_stiffness – The stiffness of the wall in kNm2/m for each stage.

Return type

Dict[int, List[float]]

plot_results_html(out_folder: str)¶

Method to plot the shear, bending moment and displacement of the wall for each stage. Output is a interactive html plot created using the Bokeh plotting library.

Parameters

out_folder (str) – The folder path to save the results at.

Returns

Return type

None

plot_results_pdf(out_folder: str) → None¶

Method to plot the shear, bending moment and displacement of the wall for each stage. Output is a static pdf plot created using the Matplotlib plotting library.

Parameters

out_folder (str) – The folder path to save the results at.

Returns

Return type

None

results_to_excel(out_folder: str) → None¶

Method to exports the wall results to an excel file where each sheet in the spreadsheet is a design case. The spreadsheet also a title sheet and the envelopes.

Parameters

out_folder (str) – The folder path to save the results at.

Returns

Return type

None

Water¶

This module holds the class for the Water object.

class frewpy.models.water.Water(json_data)¶

A class used to contain any water related functionality of frewpy.

get_water_pressures() → Dict[int, Dict[str, dict]]¶

Function to get the pore water pressure for each stage and node.

Returns

water_pressures – The pore water pressures along the wall.

Return type

Dict[int, Dict[str, dict]]

Utililities¶

This module holds all the core utility functions used throughout the library. These functions are intended to simplify common tasks and to make their output and functionality consistent where needed.

frewpy.utils.check_json_path(file_path: str) → None¶

Checks whether the path is a valid json path.

Parameters

file_path (str) – Absolute file path to the Frew model.

Raises

FrewError – If the path is not a string, doesn’t exists or is not to a json file.

frewpy.utils.clear_results(json_data: dict) → dict¶

Clears the results in the json file so that it can be analysed using the COM interface.

Parameters

json_data (dict) – A Python dictionary of the data held within the json model file.

Returns

json_data – A Python dictionary of the data held within the json model file without the results.

Return type

dict

frewpy.utils.get_design_case_names(json_data: dict) → List[str]¶

Returns the names of the design cases present in the model.

Parameters

json_data (dict) – A Python dictionary of the data held within the json model file.

Returns

design_case_names – The names of the design cases in the Frew model.

Return type

List[str]

frewpy.utils.get_file_history(json_data: dict) → List[Dict[str, str]]¶

Returns the file history of the Frew model.

Parameters

json_data (dict) – A Python dictionary of the data held within the json model file.

Returns

file_history – Records of when the file has been opened in Frew and by which user.

Return type

List[Dict[str, str]]

frewpy.utils.get_file_version(json_data: Dict[str, list]) → str¶

Returns the file version of the Frew model.

Parameters

json_data (dict) – A Python dictionary of the data held within the json model file.

Returns

file_version – The version of the model file showing the exact build of Frew.

Return type

str

frewpy.utils.get_frew_version(json_data: dict) → str¶

Returns the frew version required for the Frew model.

Parameters

json_data (dict) – A Python dictionary of the data held within the json model file.

Returns

frew_version – The overall Frew version in which the model was created.

Return type

str

frewpy.utils.get_num_design_cases(json_data: dict) → int¶

Returns the number of design cases present in the model.

Parameters

json_data (dict) – A Python dictionary of the data held within the json model file.

Returns

num_design_cases – The number of design cases in the Frew model.

Return type

int

frewpy.utils.get_num_nodes(json_data: dict) → int¶

Returns the number of nodes in the Frew model.

Parameters

json_data (dict) – A Python dictionary of the data held within the json model file.

Returns

num_nodes – The number of nodes present in each stage. This will always just be 1 integer, and the function will raise an error if it is not the same for every stage.

Return type

int

frewpy.utils.get_num_stages(json_data: dict) → int¶

Returns the number of stages in the model.

Parameters

json_data (dict) – A Python dictionary of the data held within the json model file.

Returns

num_stages – The number of stages in the Frew model.

Return type

int

frewpy.utils.get_stage_names(json_data: dict) → List[str]¶

Returns the names of the stages within the Frew model.

Parameters

json_data (dict) – A Python dictionary of the data held within the json model file.

Returns

stage_names – A list of the names of stages within the Frew model.

Return type

List[str]

frewpy.utils.get_titles(json_data: dict) → Dict[str, str]¶

Returns the titles within the json model.

Parameters

json_data (dict) – A Python dictionary of the data held within the json model file.

Returns

titles – The project titles including Job Number, Job Title, Sub Title, Calculation Heading, Initials, and Notes.

Return type

Dict[str, str]

frewpy.utils.load_data(file_path: str) → Dict[str, list]¶

Loads the json file in as a Python dictionary.

Parameters

file_path (str) – Absolute file path to the Frew model.

Returns

json_data – A Python dictionary of the data held within the json model file.

Return type

Dict[str, list]

frewpy.utils.model_to_json(file_path) → str¶

Converts a .fwd Frew model to a .json Frew model.

Parameters

file_path (str) – Absolute file path to the ‘.fwd’ Frew model.

Returns

json_path – The new file path of the json file.

Return type

str
